newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ SPORT, RUGBY - Mehrtens to play for BOP in shield game.
newsitem.headline: NZ SPORT, RUGBY - Mehrtens to play for BOP in shield game.

text.p: WHAKATANE, Aug 1 - All Black first five-eighth Andrew Mehrtens will play for Bay of Plenty when they take on Ranfurly Shield holders Auckland at the Tauranga Domain on Wednesday.
In a major coup for the union, the Bay have obtained the services of Mehrtens but probably just for the one game.
All Black coach John Hart is concerned at the lack of top rugby Mehrtens has had since returning from injury, hence the deal with the Bay team.
Bay of Plenty's regular first five Andy Miller is out of action with a hamstring injury.

Bay of Plenty's chief executive officer Greg Peters said the union was excited that a player of Mehrtens' calibre was playing for them, but added the Canterbury's player's inclusion was no reflection on other players in the area.
